The greater bilby is a medium-sized marsupial, with a head-body length of 29-55 cm and a weight of 1-2.5 kg. It has large, rabbit-like ears, a long, pointed snout, and a long, slender tail. These burrows provide shelter, protection from predators, and a suitable environment for breeding and raising young. Once widespread across much of Australia, the greater bilby has experienced significant population declines due to habitat loss, predation by introduced species, and competition with other introduced herbivores.
